intro: Tetragonia spicata, commonly known as New Zealand spinach, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, edible leaves that are often used in cooking. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing growth habit with fleshy, lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers and is well adapted to saline and sandy soils. Tetragonia spicata is valued for its nutritional content and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
